page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content: The South Downs are formed from chalk and the land in this block reflects this bed rock.Very little building development has taken place and the countryside although farmed has plenty of flora and fauna.The one road that leads to the top of the Downs is an old cart track so animals are not disturbed. Birds include robins, sparrows, goldfinches, chaffinches, housemartins, magpies and starlings. On the hills are cowslips and orchids. Other plants include dogs mercury, cow parsley, stinging nettles,shepherds purse and lots of others. Animals and fish include grey squirrels, rabbits, toads, hedgehogs, pike, carp and trout. There are trees all over Firle _ Pine, horse chestnut, oak. In Firle Park there is a redwood tree.
